content: According to the United States Census Bureau, the poverty rate in Dayton, Ohio was 32.2% in 2019. Compared to other cities in Ohio, Dayton has one of the highest poverty rates. For example, Columbus has a poverty rate of 15.3%, Cincinnati has a poverty rate of 23.9%, and Cleveland has a poverty rate of 30.8%. However, there are some smaller cities in Ohio that have higher poverty rates than Dayton, such as East Cleveland with a poverty rate of 43.4% and Youngstown with a poverty rate of 41.7%.
